channel.title: code on Marie Yatsyk
channel.description: Recent content in code on Marie Yatsyk

item.title: f(x) foods
item.description: In Fall 2018, I worked as a Studio Developer for Scout. In four months, our five-person student team (three designers, two developers) created a new brand identity and assets, packaging, a brand book, and a fully-functional marketing and e-commerce website for our client â€“ a young granola bar company started by a Northeastern alumna. For the first half of the semester I focused on user experience design, helping create lo-fi packaging and website wireframes in addition to conducting user research and iterating on logo designs.

item.title: B2B Marketing Headline Generator
item.description: Just for fun, I created this generator that combines randomly-chosen buzzwords and business terms to create surprisingly plausible B2B content marketing headlines. View on GitHub

item.title: Weather App
item.description: This simple web app connects to the OpenWeatherMap and Flickr APIs to show weather in a city and a lovely random image of said city. View on GitHub This was my first-ever web app, and was originally built at the HubSpot Women's WebApp Workshop, Fall 2016.

item.title: Creative Coding Experiments
item.description: Just a silly self-portrait created using canvas shapes. Try clicking my face! A zen, randomly-generated pattern inspired by a mermaid's scales.

item.title: Anxious Tale
item.description: This interactive narrative was created in response to the prompt "elicit an emotion." I chose to explore the sensation of social anxiety. I also wanted to challenge myself to see if I could create a sense of unease and discomfort through very simple ASCII art-like illustrations. Experience the story

item.title: Sound Visualizer
item.description: This was one of my first ever coding projects, created for the Programming Basics course at Northeastern University. I wanted to create an interactive sound visualizer that responds to audio and user input. View on GitHub The mouse-following particle effects use a modified version of the particle effects are easy script by Hunter Loftis, and the particle size is tied to the volume of the sound captured from the browser microphone (using the p5.
